intro: Rondeletia diplocalyx, commonly known as the red-eyed rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking red bracts that enclose small white flowers, creating a visually appealing contrast. It typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
